(1983) }} "'''What Forever For'''" is the title of a song written by Rafe VanHoy and recorded by [[Michael Martin Murphey]]. It was released in June 1982 as the third single from the album, ''[[Michael Martin Murphey (album)|Michael Martin Murphey]]''. "What's Forever For" would be Murphey's second country hit and the first of two number ones on the country chart. The single went to number one for one week and spent sixteen weeks in the top 40.{{cite book |title= The Billboard Book Of Top 40 Country Hits: 1944-2006, Second edition|last=Whitburn |first=Joel |authorlink=Joel Whitburn |year=2004 |publisher=Record Research |page=241}} ==Chart performance== {|class="wikitable sortable" !align="left"|Chart (1982) !align="center"|Peak
